widgets.title: SSE ChNPP Open Data
widgets.intro: Search, analyze and use data for your interdisciplinary research
widgets.text: We provide open access to data from integrated security monitoring system to be used by the scientific community for interdisciplinary studies. With the proposed tools to find, process and use our data. We offer more than 130 data sets containing indicators safety at Chernobyl

widgets.title: About project
widgets.text: SSE ChNPP Open Data is the data portal based on DJ platform that provides over 100 dataset about  Integrated Automated Monitoring System (IAMS) of Chornobyl Nuclear Power Plant. You can search, analyze and use this data for interdisciplinary research. Data is tagged by type of measurements, periodicity, device location and IAMS subsystems. Rich metadata about datasets is available. We provides demo for easy to use data processing and data mining via DJ Data Processing Script You can use online Single Page App builder for developing interactive reports about your research results

widgets.title: About IAMS
widgets.intro: IAMS is an acronym for Integrated Automated Monitoring System Its main objective is monitoring of nuclear, radiation and industrial hazard sources located at Chernobyl NPP unit 4 Shelter. It provides information on the basic parameters of the Shelter status, the ChNPP site and local area.
widgets.text: IAMS ensures the integration of the separate, specific, monitoring systems into a unified automated system that allows a comprehensive processing, display, storage of the information, in a single entity. This information are used to ensure timely implementation of activities to maintain the achieved safety level and improve it as well as to allow the Shelter personnel to determine the negative tendencies in changing of the status of the Shelter hazard 2 determine the negative tendencies in changing of the status of the Shelter hazard sources.

widgets.title: Search
widgets.intro: Over 100 dataset about IAMS of Chernobyl Nuclear Power Plant
widgets.text: You can search, analyze and use this data for interdisciplinary research. Data is tagged by type of measurements, periodicity, device location and IAMS subsystems. Rich metadata about datasets is available.

widgets.title: Analyze
widgets.intro: Easy to use data processing via DJ DP script
widgets.text: You can use command for metadata manipulation, data preprocessing, data mining and visualization. Over 30 examples of data processing, data mining and data visualization.

widgets.title: Use
widgets.text: You can use online Single Page App builder for developing interactive reports about your research results

widgets.title: Open science data
widgets.intro: Open science data is a type of open data focused on publishing observations and results of scientific activities available for anyone to analyze and reuse.
widgets.text: The concept of open access to scientific data was institutionally established with the formation of the World Data Center system (now the World Data System), in preparation for the International Geophysical Year of 1957-1958. The International Council of Scientific Unions (now the International Council for Science) established several World Data Centers to minimize the risk of data loss and to maximize data accessibility.  Now, the World Data System of the International Council for Science adopted a new set of Data Sharing Principles to embody the spirit of 'open science'. These Principles are in line with data policies of national and international initiatives and they express core ethical commitments operationalized in the WDS Certification of trusted data repositories and service.

widgets.title: Open access
widgets.text: By "open access" we mean its free availability on the public internet, permitting any users to read, download, copy, distribute, print, search, or link to the full texts of these articles, crawl them for indexing, pass them as data to software, or use them for any other lawful purpose, without financial, legal, or technical barriers other than those inseparable from gaining access to the internet itself. The only constraint on reproduction and distribution, and the only role for copyright in this domain, should be to give authors control over the integrity of their work and the right to be properly acknowledged and cited.

widgets.title: Open research computation
widgets.intro: To make sense of scientific data they must be analysed
widgets.text: In all but the simplest cases, this is done by software. The extensive use of software poses problems for the reproducibility of research. To keep research reproducible, it is necessary to publish not only all data, but also the source code of all software used, and all the parametrization used in running this software.

widgets.title: Data Processing Script
widgets.intro: Easy to use data processing via DJ DP script
widgets.text: You can use command for metadata manipulation, data preprocessing, data mining and visualization

widgets.title: DJ Data Processing script
widgets.d_listeners: line1, json,area,radar,  pie, geochart, deps, scatter, table, hbar, bar

widgets.title: Single Page Apps
widgets.intro: Data Management, Data Analysis, Data Scientists Collaboration and other BI solution
widgets.text: DJ key features:Online SPA design, SPA Hosting, Widget based dashboards, Widgets interaction, Flexible navigation, Flexible page layout (device independent), Skins, Full app i18n (without reload), Management of app resources, User collaboration support, Apps Access policy. Available DJ toolkits: Toolkit for Apps Management. Toolkit for Data Management: Rich metadata support (tags, categories, lookups), full dataset i18n, dataset version service, data uploads/downloads. Toolkit for Data Analysis and Visualization: multidimensional data cube manipulation, data queries (projections, selections, joins), interactive charts, multilayered maps, tables, embedded data processing and data mining. Dj Data Processing Scripts.

script.shortName: Sort Rows A-Z order by Time

widgets.title: Search Data
widgets.intro: Our data consists of more than 130 sets of data, which are updated every month. For each indicator, we publish the average values with a periodicity of the day and month
